title: Perma-kill mode (it sounds stupid but hear me out)
body:
Ok straight to the rules:
One life per kill (life pool for any one team can be 9 maximum during an active game)
Lives can be donated
Best out of 3
Game ends automatically after 20:00
Winners are the team with the biggest life pool (draws, well the game continues until it isn't a tie) or if the enemy team has no lives
Baron is illegal
Dragon is illegal
Rift scuttler gives extra lives (if the team has less then 5)
One support only
One assassin or jg only
Three tanks max
Two adc max
Don't take towers
1 slow per team (with items)
1 stun/hook per team
Exhaust ignite flash ghost and teleport are illegal
You cant fight someone if they have less then two allies in sight then you do (if they attack first but disengage immediately after take it as they just saw your teammates, if they do this twice in 20 seconds around the same area you are free to engage) if they engage, weapons free!
Feel free to suggest any rules or improvements!

replies.body: Cool idea. A few holes are inevitable but with the right rules it could be really fun.

What if everyone picks 5-10 champions and when they die and get tagged back in they become a different champion like lives? And if a team runs out of all their lives they lose? Also, for items when they die, they'd be refunded so you would then use the gold to buy items suitable for the champion you've changed to.

Its a good idea, if we are going to get serious about this game mode we need to think of what kind of decisions that we would want players to make (ie gamemode direction) kinda like how the classic game mode you have to push nexus, and in order to do that you need secure objectives like baron or dragon/turrets/inhibs.

And there is the issue that players might suicide and waste team lives to get the champ they want
They might suicide yeah. But every game mode has its issues.
It's a good start, I can see this becoming something I'd enjoy playing. I'll do a little brainstorming to see if I can contribute any ideas.

Cheers, I appreciate that.

Yeah a gamemode that is like normal summoners rift, except you have to rely on not dying and your team to be doing good to play, so fun... Would never ever be frustrating at all...

And I don't care if people are harsh, freedom of speech right? However, judgement is very different from constructive criticism.

Sounds pretty nice, but wouldn't that just mean everyone plays overly cautious?

well there can be many fixes to that problem.
A) a timer forcing players to kill, although that might cause stress and panic.
B) A monster that hunts players down that haven't made kills
Also the idea made previously that the rest of the team get some sort of buff when another dies. so if everyone dies except for master yi and some support then they would be incredibly difficult to deal with.
C) Giving powers to people that have died, therefore influencing team strategy to lean towards cautious culling (also not ruining the fun when you see grey screen)
D) A hazardous, constantly changing map (hunger games style) that brings champs together
Or even a combination of any of the above!
That would be so fun
I had an idea like this a while back, but it was on the dominion map and whatever team is left standing at the end wins. I called it YOLO.

Doesn't sound liek a bad idea. Sounds pretty cool to me actually. I would enjoy if they brought out something like this as a temporary week-long gamemode. It'd be like a teambased Last-Man Standing sort of thing. I would maybe even suggest getting rid of towers altogether though, maybe, and just making it so that the team with no one left on it loses. I mean, we don't want no one alive with only minions on one team :P

That's what I was thinking! But if they could leave it as a custom game even if they don't include it in matchmaking then that would be cool too.

I don't know about the stupid scaling on items but other than that I like the idea. I reckon you pick a champ, having more than one could encourage suicide, then each time a player dies the enemy team gets the person that has been dead the longest gets to respawn. People who are dead could have their summoners changed to Garrison and Clairvoyance. Clair having static 50 second CD and Garrison which has a five minute CD but can only be cast on a specific tower, nexus, or inhib. This way even if you're dead you can still have an impact on the game, which would encourage teamwork, communication and make sure that you aren't doing nothing when you die. I think an objective like Baron and Drag bring back the whole team while killing a tower brings back two members. Kills bring back one. That way there is more encouragement to play objectives and stuff. Anyway that's just my take on it.
